description.narrative: Social ProtectionGlobal commitment is strengthened and ROs and COS have enhanced capacity and resources to support governments in expanding coverage and impact of social protection on children, developing and strengthening national social protection systems including in humanitarian and fragile contexts, in order to expand the coverage and impact of social protection on children., which contributes to Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Every Child an Equitable Chance in Life By 2021, UNICEF supported countries apply relevant policies, innovative approaches and evidence, to design and implement publicly and privately funded development and humanitarian interventions at scale, that give Every Child an Equitable Chance in Life

sector.narrative: Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Social ProtectionGlobal commitment is strengthened and ROs and COS have enhanced capacity and resources to support governments inexpanding coverage and impact of social protection on children, developing and strengthening national social protection systemsincluding in humanitarian and fragile contexts, in order to expand the coverage and impact of social protection on children.

description.narrative: UNICEF actively;raised;the organizations focus on social protection, including the inclusion of a dedicated goal area in the strategic plan. We continued to provide extensive guidance and technical support internally, and externally we led major interagency groups on social protection including on gender, disability, shock responsive social protection, nutrition, and finance. Resource mobilisation continued with additional support through BMZ, Norway, Ireland and Hewlett.. UNICEF supported cash transfers reached over 132 million children in 2021, and we saw significant increases in countries focusing on gender and disability inclusive social protection, as well as countries with systems better able to respond to crisis. | Status:Met | As-of Date:25/03/2022
